–ó—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á–∞–π—Ç–µ **–†–∞–ª—å—Ñ–∞ –ë—Ä–µ–º–±–ª—Å–∞**, VP Operations –≤ Alorica Philippines. –†–∞–ª—å—Ñ –ø—Ä–æ–≤—ñ–≤ –ø–æ–Ω–∞–¥ 9 —Ä–æ–∫—ñ–≤, –±—É–¥—É—é—á–∏ —Ç–∞ –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º—ñ–∑—É—é—á–∏ —Ñ—ñ–ª—ñ–ø–ø—ñ–Ω—Å—å–∫—ñ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—ó Alorica, –ø—ñ—Å–ª—è –≤–∏–¥–∞—Ç–Ω–æ—ó –∫–∞—Ä'—î—Ä–∏ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ—Å–∞–¥—ñ General Manager —É Telstra. –í—ñ–Ω –∑–Ω–∞—î BPO –∑—Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω–∏. –ê–ª–µ –Ω–∞–≤—ñ—Ç—å –∑ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å–∞–º–∏ —Å–≤—ñ—Ç–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –∫–ª–∞—Å—É —Ñ—É–Ω–¥–∞–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞ –º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—é —è–∫–æ—Å—Ç—ñ –Ω–µ –∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å—Å—è.

content.title: Automate Your Recruiting
content.description: See how DealoAgent can handle the admin so you can handle the talent.

content.text: NOTE: This is a hypothetical case study exploring how Tom Wagner, VP of Sales at Retool, could leverage DealoAgent.AI. Retool is a real, high-growth SaaS platform for building internal tools, but this scenario is imagined to illustrate DealoAgent's capabilities.

**Retool** has revolutionized how developers build internal software, scaling rapidly to become a critical part of the modern tech stack. For a sales leader steering this rocket ship, the challenge isn't just closing deals‚Äîit's maintaining velocity and visibility as the team explodes in size.
The Challenge: Scaling Without Blind Spots

Meet **Tom Wagner**, the VP of Sales at Retool. Tom is a veteran leader who knows how to build high-performance teams. But as Retool expands into the Enterprise, the complexity of managing a large, distributed sales organization creates inevitable data gaps.
His primary pain points in this hypothetical scenario revolve around 'Black Box' sales:

items: **Competitive Blindness**: In a crowded dev-tools market, competitors change pricing or launch features weekly. Tom discovers these shifts only when a rep says, 'We lost the deal because [Competitor X] offered this.' By then, it's too late.

**The 'Why' Gap**: Metrics tell Tom *that* a deal was lost, but not *why*. Was it a technical gap? Pricing? A poor demo? Limitations in CRM data mean he has to rely on anecdotal evidence from reps, which is often biased.

**Manual Management**: To maintain quality, Tom and his directors have to manually review calls and enforce playbook compliance. It's a full-time job that doesn't scale, leaving 90% of interactions unreviewed.
**Reactive Strategy**: Strategic pivots happen too slowly because they rely on quarterly post-mortems. Tom wants to pivot *instantly* based on live market feedback.

content.text: I don't want to drive by looking in the rear-view mirror. I need a real-time HUD that tells me what's happening on the road right now.
content.author: Hypothetical scenario: Tom Wagner, VP of Sales at Retool

content.text: Enter DealoAgent: The Automated Intelligence Engine

In this hypothetical transformation, Tom integrates **DealoAgent** as the intelligence layer for his sales organization. It connects to every email, call, and calendar invite, turning raw noise into structured strategy.
Tom no longer waits for lost-deal reports to learn about the market. DealoAgent monitors every conversation for competitor mentions.

**The Insight**: One morning, DealoAgent alerts Tom: *'Competitor Y has started offering a 50% discount to Series B startups. This was mentioned in 14 calls this week.'* Tom instantly spins up a counter-playbook and pushes it to the team by lunch. They save 5 deals that same week.
DealoAgent acts as a 24/7 sales coach. It monitors deal health based on *sentiment* and *momentum*, not just what the rep types in Salesforce.

**The Save**: An enterprise deal worth $100k is stalled. The rep thinks everything is fine. DealoAgent flags it to Tom: *'Key decision maker hasn't replied in 12 days. Sentiment in last email was hesitant.'* Tom pings the rep to intervene with an executive sponsor email, unblocking the deal.
Instead of guessing what features prospects want, Tom asks DealoAgent:
What are the top 3 feature requests blocking Enterprise deals this quarter?
content.author: Tom's Query

content.text: The AI scans thousands of call transcripts and returns hard data: *'1. SSO implementation (40% of blocked deals). 2. On-premise deployment options. 3. Granular permissioning.'* Tom walks into the Product meeting with irrefutable evidence, aligning the roadmap to revenue.

For a sales leader at a company like Retool, velocity is everything. DealoAgent provides the visibility to move fast *without* breaking things. By effectively 'cloning' Tom's strategic oversight across every deal, Retool can scale its sales culture as fast as its code.

content.title: Scale Your Sales Engine
content.description: See how DealoAgent can give you executive visibility over every deal.

content.text: NOTE: This is a hypothetical case study exploring how a General Partner at Balderton Capital could leverage DealoAgent.AI. Balderton Capital is a real, prominent venture capital firm, but this scenario involving Rana Yared is imagined to illustrate DealoAgent's capabilities.

At a firm as prestigious as **Balderton Capital**, focusing on European founders with global ambitions, the challenge for a General Partner isn't just picking winners‚Äîit's managing the machine that finds them. With a diverse team and investments across fintech, enterprise software, and more, maintaining a 'God's eye view' of the firm's activities is a monumental task.
The Challenge: The Fog of War

Meet **Rana Yared**, a General Partner at Balderton Capital. Rana is an experienced investor with a deep background in strategic investments. She wants to empower her team of principals and associates, but she often feels like she's operating in a fog.
Her primary pain points revolve around visibility and leverage:

items: **Operational Black Box**: Rana relies on weekly partner meetings and manual reports to know what her team is working on. By the time she sees a 'hot' deal in a spreadsheet, it might be too late to offer strategic guidance. The data is always lagging.

**Performance Blind Spots**: It's difficult to distinguish between 'busy work' and 'effective work.' Is an associate sending 50 emails a day actually building relationships, or just spamming? Without digging into every thread, Rana can't tell.

**Reactive Management**: When an investment thesis drifts, Rana usually finds out after a memo is written. Correcting course then is expensive and demoralizing. She finds herself reacting to problems rather than preventing them.

**Fragmented Oversight**: Deal flow data is in one system, portfolio updates in another, and email conversations in a third. There is no single 'dashboard' that tells her the health of the firm's pipeline in real-time.

content.text: I want to be a coach, not a cop. But to coach effectively, I need to know what's happening on the field in real-time, not read about it in the newspaper next week.
content.author: Hypothetical scenario: Rana Yared, General Partner at Balderton Capital

content.text: Enter DealoAgent: The AI Chief of Staff

In this hypothetical transformation, Rana implements **DealoAgent** as an oversight and intelligence layer for her vertical. It connects to the firm's communication flows and CRM, giving her a real-time pulse without micromanagement.
Rana no longer waits for the Friday report. She simply asks DealoAgent:
What are the top 3 most active deals in the Fintech vertical this week? And who are we talking to at those companies?
content.author: Rana's Query

content.text: DealoAgent instantly synthesizes data from emails, calendar invites, and CRM updates. It tells her: *'Top deal is StealthFin (Series A). Michael (Principal) has exchanged 12 emails and scheduled a partner meeting. Sentiment is very positive. Competitors mentioned: none.'* Rana gets the picture in seconds.

DealoAgent analyzes the *content* of interactions, not just the count. It highlights that while one associate is sending 100 emails with low engagement, another is sending 20 but getting deep, strategic replies from top founders.

Rana can now praise the high-leverage work and coach the other associate on messaging, using specific examples surfaced by the AI: *'Your outreach to [Founder] was great because you mentioned their specific technical challenge. Let's do more of that.'*
DealoAgent acts as an early warning system. It flags when a deal seems to be drifting from the firm's core thesis or when a diligence process is stalled.

**The Intervention**: DealoAgent notifies Rana: *'Deal [CryptoX] has been in 'Due Diligence' for 3 weeks with no new external emails. Internal sentiment is declining.'* Rana pings the lead partner immediately to make a 'kill or commit' decision, saving weeks of wasted time.

data.label: Partner Leverage
data.description: Full visibility without attending every meeting

data.label: Team Alignment
data.description: Real-time coaching based on actual data

content.text: For a leader at a firm like Balderton Capital, the goal is to make high-quality decisions at scale. DealoAgent removes the 'fog of war,' giving Rana the clarity she needs to steer the ship, mentor her team, and ensure that the firm's capital is always chasing the highest-potential opportunities.

content.title: Scale Your Oversight
content.description: See how DealoAgent can give your consultants superpowers.

content.text: NOTE: This is a hypothetical case study exploring how a VP of Operations at TaskUs could leverage DealoAgent.AI. TaskUs is a real, industry-leading digital outsourcer, but this scenario involving 'David' is imagined to illustrate DealoAgent's capabilities.

**TaskUs** has built a reputation as the BPO for the world's most innovative tech companies. They handle complex, high-stakes interactions where quality isn't just a metric‚Äîit's the product. But for the operational leaders managing thousands of agents across multiple geos, maintaining consistent quality at scale is a constant battle against the 'Review Gap'.

Meet **Arjay Angodung**, a VP of Operations at TaskUs. Arjay is responsible for major client accounts and delivering operational excellence. His clients demand perfection, but his current tools only give him a keyhole view of performance.
Arjay's operational reality is plagued by blind spots:

items: **1% QA Sample Liability**: His Quality Assurance team can realistically listen to only 1-2% of calls. This means 98% of interactions go unchecked. He lies awake at night worrying about the one compliance breach buried in that 98% that could cost the account.

**Biased QA Scoring**: When agents are scored, it's often subjective. One QA analyst might be lenient, another strict. This inconsistency frustrates agents and makes 'performance improvement plans' hard to enforce.

**Unclear Seat Utilization**: Arjay knows some agents are underutilized while others are burning out, but the data is aggregated and delayed. He struggles to prove true 'Occupancy' efficiency to his client during QBRs.

content.text: We are flying a jumbo jet with a dashboard that only updates once a week. I need to know what's happening on the floor right now, not what happened last Monday.
content.author: Hypothetical scenario: Arjay Angodung, VP of Operations at TaskUs

content.text: Enter DealoAgent: The Automated Intelligence Floor
In this hypothetical transformation, Arjay deploys **DealoAgent** across his sites. It integrates directly with the telephony switch, analyzing the audio stream of every single call in real-time.
DealoAgent doesn't sample; it listens to everything. It transcribes and scores 100% of calls against the client's specific rubric.

**The Safety Net**: If an agent misses a mandatory 'Mini-Miranda' disclosure or uses a prohibited phrase, the system flags it instantly. Arjay's dashboard lights up, and a supervisor can intervene before the call even ends. The liability risk drops to near zero.

Subjectivity is eliminated. DealoAgent scores every agent on the same criteria every time. Arjay can now see exactly who his top performers are based on distinct metrics like 'Script Adherence' and 'Customer Sentiment Adjustment', not just who the supervisors like best.
He identifies that 'Agent Sarah' has found a unique way to de-escalate angry callers. He extracts her transcript and turns it into a training module for the whole floor in minutes.
During a tense QBR with the client, they ask: 'Why was Average Handle Time high last Tuesday?' Instead of emailing a data analyst and waiting 4 hours, Arjay opens DealoAgent and asks:
Show me the top call drivers for last Tuesday impacting AHT > 10 minutes.
content.author: Arjay's Query

content.text: The AI instantly correlates the data: *'AHT spike caused by system outage on the payment gateway (34% of calls). Agents were waiting for the system to load.'* Arjay shows the chart to the client immediately, proving it wasn't an agent performance issue.

For a BPO leader like David, DealoAgent changes the game from 'surviving the volume' to 'engineering the quality'. By removing blind spots and automating the audit process, TaskUs can deliver a level of transparency and reliability that legacy competitors simply can't match.

content.title: Eliminate Your Blind Spots
content.description: See how DealoAgent can audit 100% of your calls today.

content.text: –ó—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á–∞–π—Ç–µ –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞, Enterprise Account Executive —É Slack. –í—ñ–Ω –∫–µ—Ä—É—î –ø–æ–¥–æ–≤–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—è–º –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞–∫—Ç—É –¥–ª—è –≤–µ–ª–∏–∫–æ—ó –ª–æ–≥—ñ—Å—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ—ó –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω—ñ—ó. –£–≥–æ–¥–∞ –∫–æ—à—Ç—É—î $150k/—Ä—ñ–∫. –Ü–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–Ω—ñ —Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–≤—ñ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∏ –ª—é–±–ª—è—Ç—å Slack. –í–æ–Ω–∏ –∂–∏–≤—É—Ç—å —É –Ω—å–æ–º—É. –ê–ª–µ –Ω–æ–≤–∏–π CFO –≤–∑—è–≤ –∫—É—Ä—Å –Ω–∞ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è –≤–∏—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç.

–î–µ–≤—ñ–¥ –æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º—É—î —ñ–º–µ–π–ª –≤—ñ–¥ HR-–¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ –∫–ª—ñ—î–Ω—Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–æ –Ω–∞–π–º –ø—ñ–¥—Ä—è–¥–Ω–∏–∫—ñ–≤ —É –ü–æ–ª—å—â—ñ. DealoAgent –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–∞—î —Ü–µ —è–∫ **Global Payroll Opportunity**. –ê–ª–µ –≤—ñ–Ω —Ç–∞–∫–æ–∂ –ø–æ–º—ñ—á–∞—î –¥–µ—â–æ —â–µ: –ø—ñ–¥–ø–∏—Å –≤ —ñ–º–µ–π–ª—ñ –º—ñ—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ—Å–∏–ª–∞–Ω–Ω—è –Ω–∞ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ–Ω–∫—É ¬´–í—ñ–¥–∫—Ä–∏—Ç—ñ –≤–∞–∫–∞–Ω—Å—ñ—ó¬ª, –¥–µ –≤–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–æ ¬´IT Support Specialist¬ª.

**–Ü–Ω—Å–∞–π—Ç DealoAgent**: "–ù–∞–π–º IT-–ø—ñ–¥—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∫–∏ —Å–≤—ñ–¥—á–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–µ, —â–æ –≤–æ–Ω–∏ –º–∞—é—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∏ –∑ –æ–Ω–±–æ—Ä–¥–∏–Ω–≥–æ–º –ø—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–æ—ó–≤. –¶–µ —á—É–¥–æ–≤–∞ –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤—ñ—Å—Ç—å –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ–ø–æ–Ω—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ Rippling IT Cloud —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º –∑ Payroll."

title: –Ø–∫ —ñ–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª—ñ—Ç–∏–∫ Point Nine –º–æ–∂–µ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∑—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –ø–æ—Ç—ñ–∫ —É–≥–æ–¥ –¥—ñ–ª—ñ –∑–∞ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–≥–æ—é DealoAgent
subtitle: –ì—ñ–ø–æ—Ç–µ—Ç–∏—á–Ω–µ –∫–µ–π—Å-—Å—Ç–∞–¥—ñ –ø—Ä–æ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü—ñ—é due diligence —Ç–∞ –∞–Ω–∞–ª—ñ–∑—É —Ä–∏–Ω–∫—É –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—ñ—Ö —ñ–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ü—ñ–π —É B2B SaaS —É Point Nine.
author: –ö–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ DealoAgent

content.text: –ü–†–ò–ú–Ü–¢–ö–ê: –¶–µ –≥—ñ–ø–æ—Ç–µ—Ç–∏—á–Ω–µ –¥–æ—Å–ª—ñ–¥–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—è, —â–æ —Ä–æ–∑–≥–ª—è–¥–∞—î, —è–∫ –Ü–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª—ñ—Ç–∏–∫ —É Point Nine –º—ñ–≥ –±–∏ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ DealoAgent.AI. Point Nine ‚Äî —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞ –≤–µ–Ω—á—É—Ä–Ω–∞ —Ñ—ñ—Ä–º–∞ —Å–≤—ñ—Ç–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –∫–ª–∞—Å—É, —â–æ —Å–ø–µ—Ü—ñ–∞–ª—ñ–∑—É—î—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ B2B SaaS, –∞–ª–µ —Ü–µ–π —Å—Ü–µ–Ω–∞—Ä—ñ–π —ñ–∑ ¬´–ú–æ—Ä—ñ—Ü–æ–º¬ª —î —É—è–≤–Ω–∏–º –¥–ª—è —ñ–ª—é—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—ó –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π DealoAgent.
